caption.title: Nanoscale Ezrin organization in A549 cells.
caption.p: ( A) A549 cells were immunolabelled for the actin-binding protein Ezrin, which was shown to be enriched in microvilli [ 18]. The cells were imaged using STORM. Microvilli are clearly distinguishable and resemble the large cluster population as observed on SNA-labelled cells and in scanning electron microscopy (SEM, inset). Scale bars: left panel: 2 Î¼m, right panel: 500 nm, inset: 200nm. ( B) Ezrin localization maps can then be used to set a threshold for the clusters size obtained from DBSCAN clustering to specifically analyze the non-microvilli cluster population in SNA localization maps ( Fig 2).
Click here for additional data file.
